      • parseTerm

      • _parseTerm

        public Term _parseTerm(java.lang.String s)
                throws TextPerception.InvalidInputException
        Top-level method that react a Term in general, which may recursively call itself.

        There are 5 valid cases: 1. (Op, A1, ..., An) is a CompoundTerm if Op is a built-in getOperator 2. {A1, ..., An} is an SetExt; 3. [A1, ..., An] is an SetInt; 4. is a Statement (including higher-order Statement); 5. otherwise it is a simple term.

        Parameters:
        s0 - the String to be parsed
        memory - Reference to the memory
        Returns:
        the Term generated from the String
        Throws:
        TextPerception.InvalidInputException
